title: Fail to connect to Smart Analytics
content:
You encounter the error below and can't connect to Smart Analytics:

Send request to pod <Name> timeout. Please run this script again. Exit.

Cause

This issue is caused by the abnormal status of Smart Analytics components.

Solution

  1. Access https://<EXTERNAL_ACCESS_HOST>/bo/.
  2. Click CONFIGURATIONS > Smart Analytics > GO TO SMART ANALYTICS .

  3. Check the status of all components that are listed in the table and see if any component is in the Offline status.
    If there is any component in Offline status, log in to a control plane node of the suite and then run the kubectl get pods --all-namespaces | grep smartacommand to display a list.
    For example,

    NAMESPACE

    NAME

    READY

    STATUS

    RESTARTS

    AGE

    itsma1

    smarta-saw-con-0

    1/1

    Running

    0

    1d

    itsma1

    smarta-saw-con-1

    1/1

    Running

    0

    1d

    itsma1

    smarta-saw-dah-0

    1/1

    Running

    0

    1d

    itsma1

    smarta-saw-dih-380843128-bc0c6

    1/1

    Running

    0

    1d

    itsma1

    smarta-saw-proxy-3728899644-1vqz2

    1/1

    Running

    0

    1d

    itsma1

    smarta-sawarc-con-0

    1/1

    Running

    0

    1d

    itsma1

    smarta-sawarc-con-1

    1/1

    Running

    0

    1d

    itsma1

    smarta-sawarc-dah-0

    1/1

    Running

    0

    1d

    itsma1

    smarta-sawarc-dih-322845628-69zk6

    1/1

    Running

    0

    1d

    itsma1

    smarta-sawmeta-con-0

    1/1

    Running

    0

    1d

    itsma1

    smarta-sawmeta-con-1

    1/1

    Running

    0

    1d

    itsma1

    smarta-sawmeta-dah-0

    1/1

    Running

    0

    1d

    itsma1

    smarta-sawmeta-dih-2878160482-jl9p6

    1/1

    Running

    0

    1d

    itsma1

    smarta-stx-agent-2103939589-n49h6

    1/1

    Running

    0

    1d

    itsma1

    smarta-stx-category-4023756356-tc7s2

    1/1

    Running

    0

    1d

    itsma1

    smarta-stx-media-2585853560-mb3xc

    1/1

    Running

    0

    1d
    …… …… …… …… …… ……
  4. If the value in the STATUS column isn't "Running", or the value in the READY column is "0/1" or "1/2", run the kubectl logs <NAME> -n <NAMESPACE> command to check the log.
  5. If detailed log information is required, find the corresponding configuration file, locate the [Logging] section, set the value of the logLevel parameter to full, and then restart the component for troubleshooting purpose. You must change the value back to normal afterwards. 

See the following table for the configuration file locations.

NAME Configuration file location
smarta-stx-media-<number>-<hash> <Smart Analytics NFS folder>/config/idol/stx/imageserver/imageserver.cfg
smarta-stx-category-<number>-<hash> <Smart Analytics NFS folder>/config/idol/stx/category/category.cfg
smarta-stx-agent-<number>-<hash> <Smart Analytics NFS folder>/config/idol/stx/agentstore/agentstore.cfg
smarta-sawarc-dih-<number>-<hash> <Smart Analytics NFS folder>/config/idol/sawarc/dih/dih.cfg
smarta-sawarc-con-0 <NFS folder>/itsma-smarta-sawarc-con-0/smarta-sawarc-con-0/config/Content.cfg
smarta-sawarc-con-1 <NFS folder>/itsma-smarta-sawarc-con-1/smarta-sawarc-con-1/config/Content.cfg
smarta-saw-dih-<number>-<hash> <Smart Analytics NFS folder>/config/idol/saw/dih/dih.cfg
smarta-saw-con-0 <NFS folder>/itsma-smarta-saw-con-0/smarta-saw-con-0/config/Content.cfg
smarta-saw-con-1 <NFS folder>/itsma-smarta-saw-con-1/smarta-saw-con-1/config/Content.cfg
smarta-sawmeta-dih-<number>-<hash> <Smart Analytics NFS folder>/config/idol/sawmeta/dih/dih.cfg
smarta-sawmeta-con-0 <NFS folder>/itsma-smarta-sawmeta-con-0/smarta-sawmeta-con-0/config/Content.cfg
smarta-sawmeta-con-1 <NFS folder>/itsma-smarta-sawmeta-con-1/smarta-sawmeta-con-1/config/Content.cfg

To restart a component, run the kubectl delete pod <NAME> -n <NAMESPACE> command. Wait several minutes, and then run the kubectl get pods --all-namespaces | grep smarta command to check if the component is started.
